You perform the steps below to translate unbound strings: those that are not bound to a form. For more information, see Translation Process. To Translate Unbound Strings Open the ([~/?ScreenId=SM200540|SM200540]) Translation Dictionaries (SM200540) form. In the Language box, select the check boxes for the languages to which you want to translate the strings. To view unbound strings in the tables, select the Show Only Unbound check box. To translate a string, do the following on the Collected tab: In the Default Values table, select the string you want to translate. If the string has only one occurrence in the system (that is, only one row is displayed in the Key-Specific Values table), type the translation in the [Target language] column (that is, the column with the name of the target language). If the string has multiple occurrences in the system, do the following: In the [Target language] column of the Default Values table, type the translation that is appropriate for most of the occurrences. In the [Target language] column of the Key-Specific Values table, type the translations for specific occurrences that differ from the translation in the Default Values table. If the translation of the occurrence in the Key-Specific Values table is the same as the translation in the Default Values table, leave the [Target language] column blank. The translation in the Default Values table applies to all occurrences of the string, regardless of the filtering applied on the form, except the occurrences with a translation specified in the Key-Specific Values table. On the form toolbar, click Save to save your changes. If the string was translated into all languages defined in the system, the string is automatically hidden. Repeat Steps 4 and 5 until you translate all unbound strings in the system.

In Self-Service Portal, you can exclude from the translation process strings that do not need to be translated by using the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SM_20_05_40|Translation Dictionaries] ([~/?ScreenId=SM200540|SM200540]) form, as described in the procedure below. For more information, see [HelpRoot_SS_Portal_Admin\SP__con_Translation_Process|Translation Process]. ==To Exclude Strings from Translation==[anchor|#_ad7242c6-ab1d-483f-9afc-1f0542b762b4] #Open the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SM_20_05_40|Translation Dictionaries] ([~/?ScreenId=SM200540|SM200540]) form. #In the '''Language''' box, select the check boxes for the language or languages to which you want to translate the strings. #For each string that you want to exclude (with all its occurrences) from translation, in the '''Default Values''' table on the '''Collected''' tab, select the '''Do Not Translate''' check box in the string row. #On the form toolbar, click '''Save''' to save the changes. #:The excluded strings and their occurrences are automatically hidden from the tables on the '''Collected''' tab.

To Exclude Strings from Translation In Self-Service Portal, you can exclude from the translation process strings that do not need to be translated by using the ([~/?ScreenId=SM200540|SM200540]) Translation Dictionaries (SM200540) form, as described in the procedure below. For more information, see Translation Process. To Exclude Strings from Translation Open the ([~/?ScreenId=SM200540|SM200540]) Translation Dictionaries (SM200540) form. In the Language box, select the check boxes for the language or languages to which you want to translate the strings. For each string that you want to exclude (with all its occurrences) from translation, in the Default Values table on the Collected tab, select the Do Not Translate check box in the string row. On the form toolbar, click Save to save the changes. The excluded strings and their occurrences are automatically hidden from the tables on the Collected tab.

row.column: Customizing the Self-Service PortalYou can customize your Acumatica Self-Service Portal instance to make the it better suit your needs. If you have sufficient access rights, you can sign in to your Self-Service Portal instance and use the customization functionality to import and publish prepared customization projects. This topic describes the most pertinent points in Self-Service Portal customization. For more information on customizing Acumatica ERP, see the Acumatica ERP Customization Guide Acumatica ERP Customization Guide. Access Rights to Customization Functionality To get the appropriate access needed for customizing Self-Service Portal, a user account must be granted the Customizer or Administrator role. We recommend that you assign users to this role only during initial system setup so they can define roles and enter users. Then use the role only in extraordinary cases. For more information, see To Assign the Customizer Role to a User Account in Acumatica ERP Customization Guide. Customization Functionality on Self-Service PortalAfter signing in to Self-Service Portal, you can view and access the following customization functionality, which you use to access other customization tools and facilities: The Customization menu on the form title bar The ([~/?ScreenId=SM204505|SM204505]) Customization Projects (SM204505) form in the Administrator module of the Configuration suite For more information, see Acumatica Customization Platform in Acumatica ERP Customization Guide.

row.PlainText: Customizing the User Interface In Acumatica Self-Service Portal, you can flexibly customize the user interface (in particular, main menu items and workspace links) all users will see to adjust it to the business processes of your organization. Your customization of the user interface will make it easier for users to find and begin working with required forms and speeding document processing on the portal. In this chapter, you will find information about the customization of the user interface that can be performed by users with the Administrator user role. In This Chapter Customization of the User InterfaceTo Add and Configure a WorkspaceTo Add a Link to a WorkspaceTo Delete a Tile from a Workspace To Delete a WorkspaceTo Display and Hide Forms in a WorkspaceTo Regroup Forms in a Workspace To Remove a Form from a Workspace To Rename a WorkspaceTo Reset Menu Settings

row.column: Customization of the User Interface The user interface of Self-Service Portal provides predefined user interface elements, such as workspaces and workspace tiles and links, which you can configure to adjust the user interface to the business processes of your organization. Because portal users can locate the forms they use most right away, they can perform their working tasks related to Self-Service Portal more easily. If your user account is assigned the Administrator or Portal Admin role, you customize the user interface in the special Menu Editing mode. The changes you make in this mode are applied to all users of Acumatica ERP. For the description of the user interface elements, see Self-Service Portal Interface in the Self-Service Portal Guide. In this topic, you will read about the capabilities in the system for customizing the user interface. Customization of the User Interface You can customize the user interface as follows: Adjust the list of workspaces that are items on the main menu: You can keep in the user interface only the workspaces that correspond to the business processes of your organization. To perform this task, you can add new workspaces and populate them with items (tiles and links that provide access to forms), delete existing menu items for workspaces that do not comply with your business processes, and rename existing workspaces. For details, see Management of the Workspaces Listed on the Main Menu Management of the Workspaces Listed on the Main Menu. Change the items of a workspace: You can customize a workspace so that only the items that portal users need to solve their tasks are displayed there. You can change the list of forms and dashboards in a workspace, regroup the links to forms in a workspace, reorder the links to forms in a category, remove unnecessary tiles and links to forms and dashboards from a workspace, and reorder tiles in a workspace. For more information, see Management of Workspace Tiles and Links Management of Workspace Tiles and Links. By using Menu Editing mode, you can customize the user interface in a variety of ways. To switch to this mode, on the main menu, you click the configuration menu button ( ) and then click Edit Menu . The Edit Menu item is available for only users with the Administrator or Portal Admin role. If you customize the user interface in this mode and then decide to return the initial state of the main menu and all workspaces, you can reset the menu settings to default. Changes in the following menu elements will be reset: The list of workspaces that are items on the main menu and the More Items menu Items in each workspace, including categories, tiles, and links to forms and dashboards Items in quick menu of each workspace for all users of the system Workspaces pinned to the main menu and unpinned from the main menu for all users of the system For details, see To Reset Menu Settings. Management of the Workspaces Listed on the Main Menu The main menu is the primary navigation tool that you and portal use when you start working in Self-Service Portal. The system provides you with predefined workspaces list that is displayed in the main menu. The list of workspaces that a user sees by default is determined by the features enabled based on your Acumatica ERP license and the access rights of the user roles assigned to the particular user account. You must configure access rights for users to each form that belongs to a workspace. For details, see Managing Access to Self-Service Portal. If the default list of workspaces (that is, the items on the main menu) does not correspond to the business processes of your organization, you can configure the list as follows: Rename existing workspaces: If a title of any existing workspace is not optimal for portal users, you can change the title to help users easily find the forms they need. For the steps you need to perform to rename a workspace, see To Rename a Workspace. Delete existing workspaces: If a predefined workspace does not fit the business processes of your organization and will not be needed by portal users, you can completely delete it from the portal. When you delete a workspace, the system completely deletes tiles that belonged to the workspace, but forms and dashboards that belonged to the workspace remain in the system; you can add to other workspaces links to these forms and dashboards. For the procedure that describes how to delete a workspace, see To Delete a Workspace. Add new workspaces: If your organization has a specific business process that requires forms and dashboards from different functional areas to be gathered on one menu for users' convenience, you can create a custom workspace and pin it to the main menu panel. For details, see To Add and Configure a Workspace. Management of Workspace Tiles and Links Workspaces are used in the system to organize links to forms and dashboards in a way that is convenient to users. By default, each workspace contains tiles (buttons that provide users with quick access to frequently used forms) and links to forms and dashboards grouped by categories (such as Profiles and Preferences ). Each organization has its own business processes and uses sets of Self-Service Portal forms and dashboards based on these processes. To make a workspace convenient for portal users, you can do the following: Change the default list of links to forms and dashboards displayed in a workspace: If you need different forms and dashboards to be displayed in a workspace, you can change the default list by showing the items that are hidden by default and hiding the items that are displayed by default. For details, see To Display and Hide Forms in a Workspace. Add new links to forms and dashboards to a workspace: If a link to a form and dashboard is not on a workspace by default but portal users want to have it in this workspace, you can add the required link to any Self-Service Portal form or dashboard to the workspace. For more information, see To Add a Link to a Workspace. If a link to a form is not added to any of workspaces you cannot find this form by using the Search box on the top pane of the Self-Service Portal screen. Regroup links to forms and dashboards in a workspace: If the default grouping of links to forms and dashboards in a workspace is inconvenient for portal users, you can move these links to other existing categories, or create a category that fits the terminology used by portal users. Changes to grouping settings affect only the workspace in which they are changed. For details, see To Regroup Forms in a Workspace . If you need to move a link to an existing category, which is displayed in a workspace, in the Menu Editing mode, you can simply drag the link to the category. Reorder links to forms and dashboards in a category: In the Menu Editing mode, you can reorder links to forms and dashboards in a category by dragging each link to a necessary position. Remove links to forms and dashboards from a workspace: If you are sure that users will not need a particular link to a form or dashboard in a workspace, you can remove this link from the workspace. (The form or dashboard will remain in the system.) For more information, see To Remove a Form from a Workspace . Delete preconfigured tiles: If portal users do not use functions preconfigured in tiles, you can delete the tiles from a workspace to have more space in the workspace. For details, see To Delete a Tile from a Workspace . After you delete a tile, you will be able to restore it only when restoring menu settings to default. Reorder tiles in a workspace: In the Menu Editing mode, you can reorder tiles in a workspace by dragging each tile to a necessary position.

To Add and Configure a Workspace If the predefined workspaces do not include a particular business process of your organization, you can create a workspace and configure it to fit portal users' work related to this process. In this topic, you will read about how to create and configure a workspace. To Create a Workspace On the main menu, click the configuration menu button ( ), and then click Edit Menu to switch to Menu Editing mode. On the top toolbar (top left), click Add Workspace . In the Workspace Parameters dialog window, specify the following settings: In the Icon box, select the icon that will be associated with the workspace. In the Area box, select the general functional area (such as Financials ) by which the workspace will be displayed in the More Items menu. In the Title box, type the unique title you want to be used for the workspace. Click OK to save your changes. To Configure a New Workspace On the main menu, click the configuration menu button ( ), and then click Edit Menu to switch to Menu Editing mode. On the main menu, click the title of the workspace you want to configure. On the top toolbar, click Add Menu Item . In the Select Forms dialog box, select the check boxes to the left of all forms and reports you want to add to the workspace. You can use the Search box in the top of the dialog box to narrow the range of forms and reports displayed; only forms and reports with the search string in their name or ID are displayed. Click Add & Close to save your changes and close the dialog box. If you want to group forms and reports by categories, do the following: If a category with the required title does not exist, you first create the category as follows: In the top right corner (on the top toolbar), click Menu Settings . On the toolbar of the Workspace Categories menu, click Add Category . In the Category Parameters dialog box, type the category title and click OK . Click Menu Settings to close the menu. Point to the title of a form or report that you want to group by a category and on the pop-up toolbar, click Edit ( ) to open the Item Parameters dialog box. In the Category box, select the category to which you want to add the form or report, and click OK . Repeat Steps b and c for each form or report that you need to place under a particular category. On the workspace title bar, click Pin ( ) to display the new workspace on the main menu. In the bottom left corner of the screen, click Exit Menu Editing to save your changes and exit Menu Editing mode.

To Add a Link to a Workspace You can add a link to a form or report to a workspace even if it is not in the menu by default, as described in this topic. To Add a Link to a Workspace On the main menu (lower left), click the configuration menu button ( ), and then click Edit Menu to switch to Menu Editing mode. On the main menu, click the title of a workspace whose menu items you want to change. On the top toolbar, click Add Menu Item . In the Select Forms dialog box, do the following: Optional: In the Search box, type the title or ID of the form or report you want to add to the workspace. Select the check box on the left of the form title. Repeat the previous two substeps for all forms or reports you want to add to the workspace. Click Add & Close . Select the check box to the left of each added form or report title to display the form or report in the Full Menu view of the workspace. In the bottom left corner of the screen, click Exit Menu Editing to save your changes and exit Menu Editing mode.

To Display and Hide Forms in a Workspace If you want to adjust the list of forms displayed in the All Items view of a workspace based on the business processes of your organization, you can display the links to forms that were hidden and hide the links that were displayed, as described in this topic. To Display a Form in a Workspace On the main menu (bottom left), click the configuration menu button ( ), and then click Edit Menu to switch to Menu Editing mode. If you cannot find the form you want to display in the workspace, you first need to add this form to the workspace. For details, see To Add a Link to a Workspace. Repeat the previous step for each hidden form that you want to display in the workspace. In the bottom left corner of the screen, click Exit Edit Menu to save your changes and exit Menu Editing mode. Repeat this step for each visible form that you want to hide from the workspace. In the bottom left corner of the screen, click Exit Edit Menu to save your changes and exit the Menu Editing mode.
